item.title: Version v1.1.1
item.description:
Annotate v1.1.1

üéØ Highlights

Annotate now supports Intel Macs with a universal binary and runs on macOS 14.0 (Sonoma) and later, expanding compatibility for more users.

üêõ Bug Fixes

Intel Mac Support (#26, #35)

  • Problem Solved: App was not supported on Intel-based Macs and some Sequoia systems
  • Impact: Users on Intel Macs can now install and run Annotate

üîß Improvements

  • Compatibility:
    • Lowered deployment target from macOS 15.2 to macOS 14.0 (Sonoma)
    • Built universal binary with both arm64 and x86_64 architectures
    • Replaced macOS 15+ APIs with backward-compatible alternatives:
      • SwiftUI.Rectangle() instead of .contentShape(.rect)
      • NSEvent monitor instead of .onKeyPress/.onExitCommand
      • Removed .focusEffectDisabled() modifier

See the full changelog for details.

item.title: Version v1.1.0
item.description:
Annotate v1.1.0

üéØ Highlights

This release introduces a cursor highlighting system with spotlight and click effects, designed to enhance cursor visibility during presentations and screen recordings. The spotlight effect creates a customizable glow that follows your cursor, while click effects provide visual feedback with ring animations when clicking.

üöÄ New Features

Cursor Highlight System (#33)

  • Spotlight Effect: Configurable glow that follows the cursor across all screens (size: 30-100px)
  • Click Effects: Ring animation on mouse down/up with visual hold state feedback
  • Color Customization: Preset color palette for personalizing effect colors
  • Size Controls: Adjustable sliders for effect and spotlight sizes
  • Keyboard Shortcut: Toggle click effects on/off with configurable shortcut (K by default)
  • Multi-Screen Support: Works seamlessly across all connected displays

üêõ Bug Fixes

  • Local Mouse Monitors: Fixed cursor effects to properly handle frontmost app events (#33)
  • Overlay Integration: Enabled click effects on the annotation overlay for consistent behavior
  • CI Build Numbers: Fixed build numbering to use git commit count for monotonic versioning

üîß Improvements

  • Rendering Performance: Refactored to use CAShapeLayer for efficient release animation rendering
  • Simplified Architecture: Streamlined click effects to always-on mode when enabled
  • Test Coverage: Added comprehensive test suite for CursorHighlightManager

See the full changelog for details.

item.title: Version v1.0.11
item.description:
Annotate v1.0.11

üéØ Highlights

This release introduces an Eraser Tool for precise annotation cleanup and delivers critical improvements to fullscreen mode support, making Annotate truly non-intrusive across all screen contexts.

üöÄ New Features

Eraser Tool (#28)

  • Interactive Eraser: Click and drag to delete annotations with brush-like precision
  • Universal Support: Works with all annotation types (pen, highlighter, arrows, lines, rectangles, circles, text, counters)
  • Smart Detection: 12pt radius collision detection for accurate erasure
  • Full Undo/Redo: Erased annotations can be restored with undo operations
  • Keyboard Shortcut: Press E to activate eraser mode

üêõ Bug Fixes

Fullscreen Mode Support (#30)

  • Non-Intrusive Operation: App no longer activates or steals focus when overlay is toggled
  • Fullscreen Compatibility: Overlay now displays correctly above fullscreen applications (Safari, Chrome, presentations, etc.)
  • Improved Window Management: Refactored to use NSPanel with .nonactivatingPanel style for better system integration
  • Dynamic Window Levels: Automatically calculates optimal window level to stay above all system windows

üîß Improvements

  • Settings UI: Added eraser shortcut configuration to settings panel
  • Keyboard Hints: Added modifier key requirement hints in settings for better discoverability
  • Enhanced Testing: Comprehensive unit test coverage for eraser tool and overlay window behavior
  • Code Quality:
    • Removed unnecessary app activation calls
    • Simplified window level management
    • Better panel behavior with canBecomeMain and acceptsFirstMouse implementations
  • Documentation: Updated README with eraser tool documentation and refreshed keyboard shortcuts table

See the full changelog for details.

item.title: Version v1.0.10
item.description:
Annotate v1.0.10

üéØ Highlights

This release introduces a Selection Mode with full clipboard support, a modernized settings interface, and numerous quality-of-life improvements to make annotation workflows even smoother.

üöÄ New Features

Selection Mode (#24)

  • New Selection Tool: Select, move, copy, and manipulate annotations with a dedicated selection mode
  • Clipboard Operations:
    • Cmd+C to copy selected annotations
    • Cmd+V to paste annotations
    • Cmd+X to cut annotations
    • Cmd+D to duplicate selected annotations
  • Select All: Cmd+A now works globally across all modes to select all annotations
  • Keyboard Delete: Press Delete key to remove selected annotations
  • Mouse Button Support: Navigate with backward/forward mouse buttons
  • Smart Selection: Selection automatically clears when switching away from select mode
  • Visual Feedback: Consistent selection outline for better visibility

Modernized Settings UI (#27)

  • Tabbed Interface: Clean, organized settings with dedicated tabs for different configuration areas
  • Dynamic Menu Updates: Menu keyboard shortcuts now sync automatically with custom shortcut changes
  • Better Organization: Improved layout and grouping of related settings

üêõ Bug Fixes

  • Fixed undo and redo functionality to work correctly with all annotation types
  • Improved selection state management when switching tools

üîß Improvements

  • Enhanced Testing: Added comprehensive unit tests for selection mode, clipboard operations, and shortcut manager
  • Code Quality:
    • Improved type safety in clipboard operations
    • Better UserDefaults injection for test isolation
    • Removed redundant clipboard menu items
    • Cleaned up unnecessary sandbox entitlements
  • Documentation: Updated README with latest features and clearer keyboard shortcut documentation

See the full changelog for details.
